item.title: Moparclassic - Downloadable client
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

[quote=“Kaibutzu, post:15, topic:428797”][quote author=latifundio link=topic=531492.msg3884980#msg3884980 date=1326373380]

I would definitely not do that, you certainly want a newer Sun Java.

I posted it since he could be trying to play on old hardware, and only for the purpose of playing on the webclient. He could use another web browser for anything else.

I did check how much memory does take running firefox and the webclient and it was 81mb firefox and 105mb for the MSC client. So it is 186mb total + other services running, he is in real bad situation if he got a pc with let say 256mb ram? or even a 128mb (2001), and im not gonna suggest he buys a new pc just because he can’t run the client.
[/quote]
if your pc is that much shit i would[/quote]
Well i have a laptop isn’t new but i can play anything i want just fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparclassic - Downloadable client
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:11, topic:428797”][quote author=waj link=topic=531492.msg3884325#msg3884325 date=1326315979]

Why cant you use the webclient?
Join IRC to find the info you need to join, and help find bugs for the server.

Sorry bro my pc cant handle a web browser & client running at the once, I need client only pls

What OS you got? if you have windows XP you could try installing the old jvm http://marksxp.mvps.org/WindowsXP/java.php

If i can remember well microsoft java used less memory but only worked on Internet Explorer.

I would definitely not do that, you certainly want a newer Sun Java.

As to a ‘downloadable client’, you should probably stick to the webclient for now, because if/when it changes you won’t have the latest code.

But once its up and running smoothly will there be the choice of webclient and a downloadbale client?
[/quote]Why? How did you originally play RSC?[/quote]
A non-memory hogging loader…

@Nothing I have a pc what can’t run a web browser and rsc client, and your problem with that is what? If it does me fine why should it matter to you?

Read full topic

So it is 186mb total + other services running, he is in real bad situation if he got a pc with let say 256mb ram? or even a 128mb (2001), and im not gonna suggest he buys a new pc just because he can’t run the client.[/quote]

item.title: Moparclassic - Downloadable client
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:13, topic:428797"]The RSCD client is a huge memory hog. Didn’t original RSC client only take up to 30MB of memory?

EDIT: Also, who the fuck has a pc that can’t run web browser and rsc client? I mean…If my PC from 1999 could do it, why can’t his?[/quote]
Old laptops or pcs had microsoft jvm, that why it used less memory. I jut logged on rsc and and it was taking 101mb so there almost no difference between the rscd and the original client.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparclassic - Downloadable client

The RSCD client is a huge memory hog. Didn’t original RSC client only take up to 30MB of memory?
